IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY BRINGS PEOPLE TOGETHER TO BUILD HOMES, COMMUNITIES AND HOPE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY BRINGS PEOPLE TOGETHER TO BUILD HOMES, COMMUNITIES AND HOPE.
IRS990.Desc: TO RENOVATE OR BUILD SAFE, DECENT AND AFFORDABLE HOMES IN PARTNERSHIP WITH LOW-INCOME FAMILIES AND INDIVIDUALS IN THE SERVICE AREA THAT INCLUDES ANNE ARUNDEL COUNTY, BALTIMORE CITY, BALTIMORE COUNTY AND HOWARD COUNTY. HOUSES ARE CONSTRUCTED PARTLY WITH VOLUNTEER LABOR AND FUTURE HOMEBUYERS CONTRIBUTE 250 HOURS OF "SWEAT EQUITY." A CLUSTERED DEVELOPMENT STRATEGY ALSO HELPS TO STRENGTHEN COMMUNITIES. HOUSES ARE SOLD WITH NO-INTEREST MORTGAGE LOANS. MORE THAN 793 FAMILIES HAVE PURCHASED HOMES SINCE 1982.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: THE ORGANIZATION OPERATES THE HABITAT FOR HUMANITY "RESTORE", A RETAIL OPERATION, WHERE HOME FURNISHINGS, APPLIANCES AND OTHER MISCELLANEOUS ITEMS ARE DONATED OR PURCHASED AND THEN SOLD TO THE COMMUNITY AT A GREATLY REDUCED PRICE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION HOLDS TAX AND INSURANCE ESCROWS FROM MORTGAGES SERVICED IN-HOUSE. AT THE END OF THE YEAR, THE ORGANIZATION HAS PAID OUT MORE IN TAXES AND INSURANCE THAN IT HAS RECEIVED. A RECEIVABLE OF $79,757 IS INCLUDED ON THE BALANCE SHEET AT 6/30/2023.

ASC 740, INCOME TAXES, PRESCRIBES THE RECOGNITION AND MEASUREMENT OF A TAX POSITION TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN IN A TAX RETURN AS WELL AS GUIDANCE ON DE-RECOGNITION, CLASSIFICATION, INTEREST AND PENALTIES, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENT REPORTING DISCLOSURES. FOR THESE BENEFITS TO BE RECOGNIZED, A TAX POSITION MUST BE MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT TO BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION BY TAXING AUTHORITIES. THE AMOUNT RECOGNIZED IS MEASURED AS THE LARGEST AMOUNT OF BENEFIT THAT IS GREATER THAN FIFTY PERCENT LIKELY TO BE REALIZED UPON ULTIMATE SETTLEMENT. THE ORGANIZATION HAS CONSIDERED ITS INCOME TAX POSITIONS, INCLUDING ANY POSITIONS THAT MAY BE CONSIDERED UNCERTAIN BY THE RELEVANT TAX AUTHORITIES IN THE JURISDICTIONS IN WHICH THE ORGANIZATION OPERATES. AS OF JUNE 30, 2023 AND 2022, THE ORGANIZATION HAD NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS. THE ORGANIZATION RECOGNIZES INTEREST AND PENALTIES ACCRUED ON ANY UNRECOGNIZED TAX EXPOSURES AS A COMPONENT OF INCOME TAX EXPENSE. THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT HAVE ANY AMOUNTS ACCRUED RELATING TO INTEREST AND PENALTIES AS OF JUNE 30, 2023 AND 2022. THE ORGANIZATION IS SUBJECT TO ROUTINE AUDITS BY TAXING JURISDICTIONS; HOWEVER, THERE ARE CURRENTLY NO AUDITS IN PROGRESS.
COST OF GOODS SOLD NETTED WITH REVENUE 273,904.
COST OF GOODS SOLD NETTED WITH REVENUE 273,904. BOTF, INC. DEPRECIATION FOR AFFILIATE NOT INCLUDED ON 990 14,382.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: LOW INCOME HOME BUILDING AND RENOVATION

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAINTAINS RECORDS TO SUBSTANTIATE THE AMOUNT OF GRANTS; HOWEVER, THE ORGANIZATION IS NOT RESPONSIBLE FOR THE SELECTION PROCESS OF THE GRANTS AS THE GRANTS ARE STRUCTURED AS A SUB-GRANT TO HABITAT FOR HUMANITY AFFILIATE ORGANIZATIONS. THE MONIES ARE GRANTED TO THE ORGANIZATION WITH THE INTENTION THAT THE ORGANIZATION WILL SUB-GRANT THE MONIES TO PRE-SELECTED HABITAT FOR HUMANITY AFFILIATE LOCATIONS. THE SELECTION PROCESS IS PERFORMED AT THE DONOR LEVEL.
LINE 25, BUILDING MATERIALS: THE AMOUNT OF ITEMS RECEIVED WERE TOO NUMEROUS TO COUNT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 10A:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE POLICIES DESCRIBED IN PART VI, SECTION B, LINES 10A-16B APPLY TO HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF THE CHESAPEAKE, INC. AND ITS AFFILIATES AS LISTED BELOW: JLR INVESTMENTS, LLC CHESAPEAKE CHDO CHESAPEAKE FUNDING COMPANY I, LLC

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY MANAGEMENT AND THE ENTIRE BOARD OF DIRECTORS PRIOR TO ITS FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL EMPLOYEES AND BOARD MEMBERS ARE REQUIRED TO READ AND SIGN THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY STATEMENT ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS MUST BE IMMEDIATELY DISCLOSED TO THE BOD. SHOULD A CONFLICT ARISE, BOD MEMBERS ARE REQUIRED TO VOTE ON THE ISSUE IN QUESTION, AND THE INTERESTED PERSON IS RECUSED FROM THE MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CEO'S COMPENSATION IS DETERMINED BY A COMPENSATION STUDY COMPARING SIMILAR NONPROFITS IN THE AREA. THE BOD AND/OR EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE INDEPENDENTLY APPROVES COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS FOR THE CEO. ALL OTHER EMPLOYEE COMPENSATION IS DETERMINED INTERNALLY USING COMPARABLE SALARIES OF OTHER LOCAL NONPROFITS AND/OR HABITAT FOR HUMANITY AFFILIATES OF SIMILAR SIZE AND ARE APPROVED BY THE CEO. THE BOARD APPROVES PERSONNEL COSTS INCLUDING SALARIES AS PART OF THE BUDGET.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND FORM 990 ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST. THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND FORM 990 ARE AVAILABLE ON THE ORGANIZATION'S WEBSITE.
THE ORGANIZATION HAS NOT CHANGED ITS OVERSIGHT OR SELECTION PROCESS FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
